        public static List<SyntaxTree> ensureListFromKleeneList(SyntaxTree listOrSingleElementOfList)

      • makeKleeneListIfNeeded

        public static <T> SyntaxTree makeKleeneListIfNeeded(Collection<T> objects)
        Returns a "kleene list"-labeled syntax tree if given list is not singleton, and the single element itself otherwise. Wraps objects into syntax trees. This is a inverse operation of ensureListFromKleeneList(SyntaxTree).

      • parse

        public static SyntaxTree parse(String string)
        Parse a string into a syntax tree by parsing it as an expression using AntlrGrinderParserWrapper returning its syntax tree.

      • replaceAtPath

        public static SyntaxTree replaceAtPath(SyntaxTree syntaxTree,
                                       List<Integer> path,
                                       SyntaxTree subTree)
        Given a syntax tree, a path, and a sub-syntax tree, returns the syntax tree with its path-sub-syntax tree replaced by the given sub-syntax tree. The path is a list of indices indicating a path in the syntax tree. If there are no indices to be followed (path is empty), the sub-syntax tree itself is returned. The method assumes the path describes an existing path-sub-syntax tree.
